intro: Pentaspadon annamense, commonly known as the Annam pentaspadon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
